comments.title: Missing authentication/authorization
comments.description: The API endpoint '/api/userdata' does not enforce a user authentication or authorization check, allowing unauthorized users to access sensitive information.

replies.content: Thanks for pointing this out. I'll add proper authentication and authorization checks to this endpoint in the next update.

comments.title: Missing input validation
comments.description: The user registration endpoint saves submitted data to the database without verifying the input, allowing invalid or malicious data to be inserted and possibly executed.

replies.content: Good catch! I'll add validation for user input before any registration is processed.

comments.title: Insecure data storage on device
comments.description: Sensitive user credentials are being stored in plain text using UserDefaults, making it easy for attackers with access to the device to read them.

replies.content: You're right, UserDefaults is not secure for sensitive data. I'll switch to using the Keychain for storing credentials.

comments.title: Hardcoded credentials found in source
comments.description: An administrative username and password are hardcoded directly in the source code, exposing sensitive secrets to anyone with access to the codebase.

replies.content: Thanks for flagging this! I'll update the code to load these credentials securely from environment variables instead.

comments.title: Unvalidated redirect vulnerability
comments.description: The OAuth callback handler redirects users to a URL specified by a query parameter without validating its value, enabling attackers to perform phishing attacks.

replies.content: Understoodâ€”I'll add validation to ensure only allowed redirect URIs are used in the callback.

comments.title: Improper certificate validation
comments.description: The network client accepts all SSL certificates, including self-signed and invalid ones, leaving the app vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks.

replies.content: I'll work on validating SSL certificates properly so only trusted servers are accepted. Thanks for highlighting this risk.

comments.title: Cross-site scripting (XSS) in comment field
comments.description: User-supplied comments are rendered on the page without being sanitized, allowing injection and execution of arbitrary JavaScript in users' browsers.

replies.content: Great catch! We'll sanitize any user input in the comment field to prevent XSS going forward.

comments.title: Sensitive information logged to console
comments.description: The application logs sensitive tokens to the console, making them visible to anyone with access to console output or device logs.

replies.content: Thanks for identifying this! I'll remove sensitive information from logs in the next revision.

comments.title: Session fixation vulnerability
comments.description: A user's session ID is not refreshed after login, allowing attackers to set or reuse an existing session and gain unauthorized access.

replies.content: Thanks for the heads up. I'll update the login handler so that it regenerates the session ID after a successful authentication.

comments.title: Unrestricted file upload
comments.description: File upload functionality saves submitted files without validating type or content, permitting attackers to upload and execute malicious code.

replies.content: I'll make sure to add file type and size validation for uploads, thanks for bringing attention to this vulnerability.

comments.title: Exposed admin endpoint
comments.description: An admin-only endpoint is available without any authentication or access control, allowing any user to perform privileged actions.

replies.content: Oops, this was an oversight. I'll add authentication and proper authorization checks to the admin endpoint immediately.

comments.title: Insecure random number generator
comments.description: The application uses arc4random() to generate security tokens, which is not cryptographically secure and may allow attackers to predict token values.

replies.content: Appreciate the feedback. I'll migrate token generation to use SecRandomCopyBytes for improved security.
